alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Dawson; Hall; Merrick; Polk (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 15 at 2:24PM CST until February 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central and south central Nebraska. * WHEN...Until noon CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall is expected to increase across Interstate 80 and areas north of Interstate 80 during the early afternoon hours, with the highest accumulations expected from roughly 6 PM Wednesday through around 6 AM Thursday morning. There will be a sharp cutoff in snowfall amounts on the north side of this snow band, with areas just north of the band likely receiving much less snow than is forecast in the advisory.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
